dt: {bc}a system (such as fat in milk) consisting of a liquid dispersed with or without an {a_link|emulsifier} in an immiscible liquid usually in droplets of larger than colloidal size
{bc}a suspension of a sensitive silver salt or a mixture of silver halides in a viscous medium (such as a gelatin solution) forming a coating on photographic plates, film, or paper

et: New Latin {it}emulsion-, emulsio{/it}, from Latin {it}emulgēre{/it} to milk out, from {it}e-{/it} + {it}mulgēre{/it} to milk; akin to Old English {it}melcan{/it} to milk, Greek {it}amelgein{/it}
shortdef: a system (such as fat in milk) consisting of a liquid dispersed with or without an emulsifier in an immiscible liquid usually in droplets of larger than colloidal size
the state of such a system

suspension; especially : a suspension of a sensitive silver salt or a mixture of silver halides in a viscous medium (such as a gelatin solution) forming a coating on photographic plates, film, or paper
